Articles.Content:
Just want to state that this thing was made for the Series X/S. I used to run it on the one X and it was ok but I couldn´t tell if it was really better than on the normal One I had before. Probably there wasn´t a difference at all but the performance was ok especially since the micro stuttering disappeared this year due to a patch I guess. So now I had the honor to try it on the Series S as the very first game installed and I have to say THIS IS IT! That´s how it´s supposed to run. It runs even better than it ever did on my PC which was pretty siilar to the One X performance but with way less boot up times. On the Series S the boot sequence is pc level but the performance on auto HDR settings 4K UHD (Skaled I guess? But it looks crisp like true 4k) is stunning. The CPU indicator remains green even for big rockets during maxQ and it runs smooth as butter.

It´s a joy and I want to make this statement for all who maybe were wondering if it was improving KSP to run it on the new Xboxes or no. It does it by a lot. I can really suggest to consider a go for a series X and also the S (if you can live with the 500GB small HDD-space). The performance is top and you will find all your XBO games in the game library ready to go.
for series S with very high performance
